required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation Of Safety, Tolerability And Pharmacokinetics Of Single And Multiple Doses Of PF-06730512
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Double Blind, Sponsor-open, Placebo-controlled, First-in-human Trial To Evaluate The Safety, Tolerability, And Pharmacokinetics Of Pf-06730512 After Single And Multiple Ascending Intravenous Infusion Or Subcutaneous Administration To Healthy Adult Subjects And An Open-label Evaluation In Healthy Japanese Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of escalating single and multiple intravenous (IV) infusions and subcutaneous (SC) injections of PF-06730512 in healthy subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Treatment Emergent Treatment-Related Adverse Event(s)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing through approximately Day 71 (single dose) or Day 113 (multiple dose)
primary_outcome.description: Number of Subjects With Treatment Emergent Treatment-Related Adverse Event(s)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with injection site reaction(s)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing through approximately Day 71 (single dose) or Day 113 (multiple dose)
primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with injection site reaction(s)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with laboratory test findings of potential clinical importance
primary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing through approximately Day 71 (single dose) or Day 113 (multiple dose)
primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with laboratory test findings of potential clinical importance

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with vital signs findings of potential clinical importance
primary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing through approximately Day 71 (single dose) or Day 113 (multiple dose)
primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with vital signs findings of potential clinical importance

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with ECG findings of potential clinical importance
primary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing through approximately Day 71 (single dose) or Day 113 (multiple dose)
primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with ECG findings of potential clinical importance

secondary_outcome.description: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of PF-06730512

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Concentration (Tmax) of PF-06730512
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to approximately Day 71 (single dose) or Day 113 (multiple dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Concentration (Tmax) of PF-06730512

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) of PF-06730512
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to approximately Day 71 (single dose) or Day 113 (multiple dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) of PF-06730512

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Extrapolated Infinite Time [AUC (0- infinity)] of PF-06730512, as permitted
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to approximately Day 71 (single dose) or Day 113 (multiple dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Extrapolated Infinite Time [AUC (0- infinity)] of PF-06730512, as permitted

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to approximately Day 71 (single dose) or Day 113 (multiple dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Clearance (CL) or Apparent Clearance (CL/F) of PF-06730512, as permitted

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to End of Dosing Interval (AUCtau) of PF-06730512
secondary_outcome.description: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to End of Dosing Interval (AUCtau) of PF-06730512

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Volume of Distribution of PF-06730512, as permitted
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to approximately Day 71 (single dose) or Day 113 (multiple dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent Volume of Distribution of PF-06730512, as permitted

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to approximately Day 71 (single dose) or Day 113 (multiple dose)

secondary_outcome.measure: Minimum observed concentration during the dosing interval (Cmin)
secondary_outcome.description: Minimum observed concentration during the dosing interval (Cmin)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of the development of anti-drug antibody (ADA) and neutralizing antibody (NAb)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to approximately Day 71 (single dose) or Day 113 (multiple dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of the development of anti-drug antibody (ADA) and neutralizing antibody (NAb)

arm_group.description: Study Drug being used in the study

intervention.description: Comparison of different dosages of PF-06730512 to Placebo
Comparison of Placebo to different doses of PF-06730512

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy female subjects of nonchildbearing potential and/or male subjects who, at the time of screening, are between the ages of 18 and 55 years, inclusive. Healthy is defined as no clinically relevant abnormalities identified by a detailed medical history, full physical examination, including blood pressure (BP) and pulse rate (PR) measurement, 12-lead electrocardiogram (ECG), or clinical laboratory tests.
- Body mass index (BMI) of 17.5 to 30.5 kg/m2; and a total body weight >50 kg (110 lb).
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of allergic reactions to diagnostic or therapeutic protein. History of recurrent infections or active infection within 28 days of screening.
Exposure to live vaccines within 28 days of screening.
- History of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), hepatitis B, or hepatitis C; positive testing for HIV, hepatitis B surface antigen (HepBsAg), hepatitis B core antibody (HepBcAb), or hepatitis C antibody (HCVAb). As an exception, a positive hepatitis B surface antibody (HBsAb) finding as a result of subject vaccination is permissible.
